required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Ventilatory Response to Hypoxia During Sedation With Dexmedetomidine Compared to Propofol in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim with this project is to investigate the effect of dexmedetomidine on control of breathing in healthy volunteers and to compare it with propofol at the same degree of sedation.

detailed_description.textblock:
15 volunteers will be investigated for their hypoxic and hypercapnic ventilatory response during sedation with dexmedetomidine and propofol in a randomized cross-over study.
6 volunteers will be investigated for their repeated response to hypoxia and hypercapnia in order to validate the method.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.time_frame: One day for each drug; before,during and after sedation with dexmeditomidine or propofol
primary_outcome.description: Acute hypoxic ventilatory response,i.e. the ventilatory response to acute hypoxia measured as change in minute ventilation over change in peripheral oxygen saturation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One day for each drug; Before, during and after sedation with dexmedetomidine or propofol
secondary_outcome.description: The acute ventilatory response to hypercapnia, i.e. change in minute ventilation over change in end-tidal carbon dioxide

other_outcome.time_frame: One day for each drug: Before, during and after sedation with dexmedetomidine or propofol
other_outcome.description: Objective signs of upper airway obstruction, e.g. Interruption of airflow at the same time as breathing movements of the thoracic wall, paradoxal breathing, increased airway resistance

other_outcome.time_frame: One day for each drug; At target sedation
other_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of dexmedetomidine or propofol

other_outcome.time_frame: One day; During the whole experimental procedure
other_outcome.description: Sedation level will be measured as Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale(RASS) the observer's assessment of alertness/sedation scale (OAA/S)

other_outcome.time_frame: One day; During the whole experimental procedure
other_outcome.description: Bispectral index (BIS) gives a number between 0-100

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male
2. Age 18-40
3. American Society of AnesthesiologistÂ´s classification (ASA) 1, i.e. healthy
4. No medication
5. No allergies
6. Non-smoker/no snuff, i.e. no nicotine intake
7. Normal weight, BMI <26
Exclusion Criteria:
Snoring

overall_official.affiliation: Karolinska University Hospital and Karolinska Institutet

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology, Surgical Sciences and Intensive Care Medicine, Karolinska University Hospital
